title: Drawing, "Design for Monument for van der Cammen-Henriques in the Church of St. Gumarus, Lier", late 17th century
medium: Graphite, pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on laid paper
inscribed: on verso in pen and brown ink: Dit is den tombe / van paus Victor den III / in s. pieterskerk  (This is the tomb of Pope Victor III in St. Peter's church.)
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: A woman crouches at the foot of an obelisk, leaning upon a sphere and holding a snake biting its tail, together with a putto who supports and escutcheon. A censer is on top of the obelisk before which two putti cross palm boughs, holding wreaths in their outside hands.  Written on the column: pilaer van der Kerck (against the pillar); in the obelisk: Swerte / steen / en / Witte / letteren (dark stone and white letters).

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Monument for van der Cammen-Henriques in the Church of St. Gumarus, Lier", late 17th century.
late 17th century. Graphite, pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-259.
